admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will assist Tunisia in
            implementing the first three years of a five year program
            for the development of rural electrification and in
            rehabilitating the urban distribution systems. The project
            will connect about 990 villages in 15 Governorates to the
            national network and improve the supply of electricity in
            about 60 towns. The project consists of the following
            components: (i) supply and erection of about 3,130 km (2,460
            km for rural electrification and 670 km for urban
            distribution) of medium tension and 2,840 km (2,060 km
            rural, and 780 km urban) of low tension lines; (ii) supply
            and installation of about 1,290 transformers for a total
            capacity of 62 MVA (32 MVA rural and 30 MVA urban); (iii)
            provision of equipment and tools for implementing the urban
            rehabilitation component; and (iv) provision of technical
            assistance for training, and a study for strengthening the
            power distribution system in Tunis. The project, when
            completed, will extend electricity services to about 30,400
            new domestic rural customers, 2,100 pumping stations and 300
            commercial and small industrial consumers, and improve the
            quality of service to more than 150,000 existing urban consumers.
